title: Add reference to math
comment: Maybe add a reference to the math for computing the lower and upper bounds. It makes checking correctness easier and you may need to refer to it at a later point in time.

title: Variable names too long
comment: I would call it df_patternmean for example.

title: Lines too long, hard to read
comment: The first line is hard to parse. Part of the problem is the long variable name. But you could also split up this line into more smaller lines with intermediate variables.\n\nIt might be clearer if you used a percentile function and got the value at 33, 66 percentiles. Also there might be a function in pandas that does this binning for you.

title: Just make new columns with pandas
comment: You can avoid the .apply here by simply making the "full symmetry" and "unidirection symmetry" columns in the dataframe.

title: Separate plotting code from data processing code
comment: This block is in the same cell as the block above. I would separate the plotting code into a different cell in jupyter noteobook.

title: Do you need to shuffle the train and test split?
comment: Are there any biases to using the first 40 rows for testing? Do you need to shuffle the test and train rows?
